intro: Lepeocercis bladhii, commonly known as the Bladh’s lepeocercis, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to the island of Madagascar, where it thrives in humid, tropical environments. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves, which are often covered in a dense layer of fine hairs. Its flowers are small and clustered, typically displaying shades of yellow and green. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Lepeocercis bladhii is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
